messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Sacramento conference was: about time, and  involvement, and older kids
messages.msgSnippet: **When exactly is the Sacramento conference? I keep ignoring it because it seems so close to the SC one. But, hell, I can drive to Sacramento from Utah. A
messages.messageBody:
**When exactly is the Sacramento conference? I keep ignoring it because
it
seems so close to the SC one. But, hell, I can drive to Sacramento from
Utah. A great teen program and new friends for Conor might make it worth it.**

It is just one week from the dates of the SC conference. Is anyone but
Pam S. going to make the heroic effort to attend both?

The conference in Sacramento is sponsored by the Homeschoool Association
of California (HSC). The conference is not exclusively unschooling, but
it is unschooler-friendly and quite relaxed. I really enjoy it!

Info should be available at:
http://conference.hsc.org

Early registration, before May 15th, and being a member of HSC can
really cut down on the conference cost.

Betsy

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Sacramento conference was: about time, and involvement, and older kids
messages.msgSnippet: ... It IS just the weekend before the South Carolina one. Conference immersion!!! -pam
messages.messageBody:

> Utah. A great teen program and new friends for Conor might make it
> worth it.

It IS just the weekend before the South Carolina one.

Conference immersion!!!

-pam

messages.subject: Sacramento conference was: about time, and involvement, and older kids
messages.msgSnippet: ... Sacramento conference in August?  With Lars?  (Or maybe the nearly broke airlines will offer dirt cheap fares?) ... When exactly is the Sacramento
messages.messageBody:
>>Are you crazy enough to want to drive all the way south from BC to the
Sacramento conference in August? With Lars? (Or maybe the nearly broke
airlines will offer dirt cheap fares?)
>
>Oh TIA!!!! Please consider it. I'll be there and the teen program is
>just fantastic - he'll make friends and have a total blast!!!>>

When exactly is the Sacramento conference? I keep ignoring it because it
seems so close to the SC one. But, hell, I can drive to Sacramento from
Utah. A great teen program and new friends for Conor might make it worth it.

Life is good.
~Mary

"The miracle is not to walk on water. The miracle is to walk on the green
earth, dwelling deeply in the present moment and feeling truly alive."

~ Thich Nhat Hanh
